measure.name: residential_clothes_washer
measure.description: Adds (or replaces) a residential clothes washer with the specified efficiency, operation, and schedule. For multifamily buildings, the clothes washer can be set for all units of the building. See https://github.com/NREL/resstock#workflows for supported workflows using this measure.
measure.modeler_description: Since there is no Clothes Washer object in OpenStudio/EnergyPlus, we look for an ElectricEquipment object with the name that denotes it is a residential clothes washer. If one is found, it is replaced with the specified properties. Otherwise, a new such object is added to the model. Note: This measure requires the number of bedrooms/bathrooms to have already been assigned.

argument.name: imef
argument.description: The Integrated Modified Energy Factor (IMEF) is the capacity of the clothes container divided by the total clothes washer energy consumption per cycle, where the energy consumption is the sum of the machine electrical energy consumption, the hot water energy consumption, the energy required for removal of the remaining moisture in the wash load, standby energy, and off-mode energy consumption. If only a Modified Energy Factor (MEF) is available, convert using the equation: IMEF = (MEF - 0.503) / 0.95.

argument.name: rated_annual_energy
argument.description: The annual energy consumed by the clothes washer, as rated, obtained from the EnergyGuide label. This includes both the appliance electricity consumption and the energy required for water heating.

argument.name: annual_cost
argument.description: The annual cost of using the system under test conditions. Input is obtained from the EnergyGuide label.

argument.name: test_date
argument.description: Input obtained from EnergyGuide labels. The new E-guide labels state that the test was performed under the 2004 DOE procedure, otherwise use year < 2004.

argument.name: drum_volume
argument.description: Volume of the washer drum. Obtained from the EnergyStar website or the manufacturer's literature.

argument.name: cold_cycle
argument.description: The washer is operated using only the cold cycle.

argument.name: thermostatic_control
argument.description: The clothes washer uses hot and cold water inlet valves to control temperature (varies hot water volume to control wash temperature). Use this option for machines that use hot and cold inlet valves to control wash water temperature or machines that use both inlet valves AND internal electric heaters to control temperature of the wash water. Input obtained from the manufacturer's literature.

argument.name: internal_heater
argument.description: The washer uses an internal electric heater to adjust the temperature of wash water. Use this option for washers that have hot and cold water connections but use an internal electric heater to adjust the wash water temperature. Obtain the input from the manufacturer's literature.

argument.name: fill_sensor
argument.description: The washer has a vertical axis and water level fill sensor. Input obtained from the manufacturer's literature.

argument.name: mult_e
argument.description: Appliance energy use is multiplied by this factor to account for occupancy usage that differs from the national average.

argument.name: mult_hw
argument.description: Appliance hot water use is multiplied by this factor to account for occupancy usage that differs from the national average. This should generally be equal to the Occupancy Energy Multiplier.

argument.name: location
argument.description: The space type for the location. 'auto' will automatically choose a space type based on the space types found in the model.

argument.name: plant_loop
argument.description: Select the plant loop for the dishwasher. 'auto' will try to choose the plant loop associated with the specified space. For multifamily buildings, 'auto' will choose the plant loop for each unit of the building.
